sentences.en: "What would you like to eat?" — "Anything'll do me, Eva."
sentences.cn: “你想吃什么？”——“我吃什么都行，伊娃。”

sentences.en: Any head teacher who made errors like this would be chucked out.
sentences.cn: 哪个校长只要犯了这样的错误都会被开除。

sentences.en: Arnold knew he would be tired the next day.
sentences.cn: 阿诺德知道自己第二天会很累。

sentences.en: Few would argue that this team has experience and proven ability.
sentences.cn: 这个队伍的丰富经验和表现出来的实力是众所公认的。

sentences.en: I had to admire David's vow that he would leave the programme.
sentences.cn: 戴维发誓要离开这个项目，我不得不对他表示钦佩。

sentences.en: I would be remiss if I did not do some-thing about it.
sentences.cn: 如果我对此不做点儿什么，就是不负责任。

sentences.en: In 1941, the train would have been pulled by a steam engine.
sentences.cn: 1941年，火车本可以由蒸汽机车拉动。

sentences.en: It would be difficult to find two men who were more dissimilar.
sentences.cn: 很难找到彼此间差异更大的人了。

sentences.en: It would soon be dark.
sentences.cn: 天很快就要黑了。

sentences.en: More people would be attracted to cycling if conditions were right.
sentences.cn: 如果天气适宜，会有更多的人被吸引到骑自行车的行列中来。

sentences.en: No one believed the soldiers stationed at the border would actually open fire.
sentences.cn: 没人相信驻扎在边境的士兵们会真的开火。

sentences.en: She said she wouldn’t be coming to the library any more.
sentences.cn: 她说她再也不会到图书馆来了。

sentences.en: The deal seems so attractive it would be ridiculous to say no.
sentences.cn: 这笔交易看上去太诱人了，要是拒绝它简直是笑话。

sentences.en: The new town would have been unrecognisable to the original inhabitants.
sentences.cn: 原来的居民可能会认不出这个崭新的城镇了。

sentences.en: They said they would meet us at 10.30 at the station.
sentences.cn: 他们说过会在10点30分到车站接我们。

sentences.en: They would have liked bare wooden floors throughout the house.
sentences.cn: 他们本想在整个房间的木地板上都不铺地毯的。

sentences.en: We gained a rich supply of data which would normally be inaccessible.
sentences.cn: 我们得到了通常难以获取的大量数据。

sentences.en: When I asked him to stop, he would not listen.
sentences.cn: 我叫他停下，可他不听。

sentences.en: When life gets hard and you want to give up, remember that life is full of ups and downs, and without the downs, the ups would mean nothing.
sentences.cn: 当生活很艰难，你想要放弃的时候，请记住，生活充满了起起落落，如果没有低谷，那站在高处也失去了意义。

sentences.en: Would he always be like this?
sentences.cn: 他会总像这样吗？

sentences.en: Would someone please tell me what is going on?
sentences.cn: 请问谁能告诉我发生什么事了？

sentences.en: Would you mind waiting outside?
sentences.cn: 您在外面等好吗？

sentences.en: Would you shut the window, please?
sentences.cn: 请把窗户关上，好吗？

sentences.en: You flatter yourself. Why would we go to such ludicrous lengths?
sentences.cn: 你真自以为是。我们为什么要费那么大的力气？

phrases.tran_cn: 你想要点什么；你喝什么
[美国英语]最好还是…；应该，必须
过去将来完成时（可用于虚拟句，表示与过去的事实相反）；过去将来完成时（表示在过去某一时间对将来某一时刻以前所会发生的动作）

trans.tran_cn: 将，会（will的过去式），就，请，肯定，愿意
将，将会〔表示想做某事或认为某事会发生〕
trans.tran_en: used to say what someone intended to do or expected to happen
used to ask someone politely to do something
You use would when you are saying what someone believed, hoped, or expected to happen or be the case
